intro: Stylidium sejunctum, commonly known as the slender triggerplant, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique trigger mechanism that facilitates pollination. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting nectar-feeding insects. Stylidium sejunctum is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
